logic

Interface PatternLoader

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DynamicBoard, Gameboard, PatternEditor, StaticBoard

    public interface PatternLoader
    Contains everything that is nessesary to implement the load pattern functionality/RLE decoder found in class LoadPattern.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void drawLoaded()
      Draws the loaded pattern to the Gameboard.
      void glueLoaded()
      Attaching the loaded pattern to the current generation, by iterating through the indexes the pattern is at and changing the values of the generation accordingly.
      void moveLoaded(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent e)
      Allows the user to move loaded patterns, and attach it to the generation.
      void rotateLoaded()
      Allows the user to rotate the loaded pattern.
      void setStartIndexLoaded()
      Setting the start indexes to the loaded pattern.
      void updateBoardWithPattern(byte[][] n)
      Initiates the loadPattern sequence.

    • Method Detail

      • updateBoardWithPattern

        void updateBoardWithPattern(byte[][] n)
        Initiates the loadPattern sequence. Setting the objects loadedPattern(byte[][]) to the input pattern. And setting the start indexes to the loaded pattern. To initiate the draw sequence.
        Parameters:
        n - the loaded pattern.
        See Also:
        setStartIndexLoaded(), drawLoaded()

      • setStartIndexLoaded

        void setStartIndexLoaded()
        Setting the start indexes to the loaded pattern. The startindexes is used both to draw the loaded pattern and to glue it to the current generation. It is manipulated through the moveLoaded method.
        See Also:
        moveLoaded(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent), drawLoaded(), glueLoaded()

      • drawLoaded

        void drawLoaded()
        Draws the loaded pattern to the Gameboard. Drawing the pattern on top of the current generation, without changeing the current generation's values. The attachment happends in the glueloaded sequence.
        See Also:
        glueLoaded()

      • moveLoaded

        void moveLoaded(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent e)
        Allows the user to move loaded patterns, and attach it to the generation. By using KeyEvent.
        Parameters:
        e - KeyEvent

      • rotateLoaded

        void rotateLoaded()
        Allows the user to rotate the loaded pattern. Transforming the pattern to rotated by creating a new pattern.

      • glueLoaded

        void glueLoaded()
        Attaching the loaded pattern to the current generation, by iterating through the indexes the pattern is at and changing the values of the generation accordingly.
